assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: hifiasm v. 0.16.1+galaxy2; Bionano Solve v. 3.7.0+galaxy0; SALSA2 v. 2.3+galaxy2

bioprojects.title: Rissa tridactyla (black-legged kittiwake) genome, bRisTri1, paternal haplotype

attributes.name: biomaterial_provider
attributes.value: University of Milan, Diego Rubolini and Vicki Friesen

biosample.biomaterialProvider: University of Milan, Diego Rubolini and Vicki Friesen

description.comment: The black-legged kittiwake is a coastal bird of the arctic to subarctic regions of the world, and are almost exclusively found at sea with the exception of the breeding period. They are found across the northern coasts of the Atlantic, from Canada to Greenland, and on the Pacific side from Alaska to the coast of Siberia. This sample is from a female caught on Middleton Island, Alaska USA, collected by Kyle Elliott, coordinated by Diego Rubolini and Vicki Friesen, and used to generate a trio-based high-quality reference genome for the Vertebrate Genomes Project (VGP). Parent samples were named bRisTri2 (mother) and bRisTri3 (father). Sequencing and genome assembly were conducted at the Vertebrate Genomes Lab (VGL) at the Rockefeller University, led by Olivier Fedrigo and Erich D. Jarvis.
description.title: Animal sample from Rissa tridactyla (Black-legged kittiwake) for VGP genome bRisTri1

assemblyInfo.comments: This assemby has the curated paternal haplotype, plus the W chromosome from the curated maternal haplotype
